page.title: 03OLD BERRY HALL
page.content: Old Berry Hall is the remains of a moated Manor House situated in woodland off the Hampton Lane. This listed building at present is for sale (Â£160,000). It stands in 1\ acres of gardens. The original house was a much larger building but much of it was destroyed in the 1800s.The present Hall has many rooms including 6 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, storerooms and pantries. Many of the rooms have garderobes, now used as dressing rooms. The front porch has been restored and the beams are carved with Latin inscriptions and a monogram of the Waring family. The Waring family lived in the house for about 200 years, until about 1718. Since then there have been a variety of owners.
